info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 8:44PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, central Pondera, northwestern Broadwater, northwestern Meagher, northern Jefferson, Teton and western Cascade Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 843 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 29 miles south of Heart Butte to near East Helena. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, Choteau, Cascade, East Helena, Fairfield, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Wolf Creek, Fort Shaw, Dupuyer, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Pishkun Reservoir, York, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, Sun River, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park, Craig, and Bynum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to minor localized flooding, or even some minor debris flow in steep terrain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
